summary:
Energetic, engaged, daring, result-driven, team leader and team player.

Professional with around 20 years experience in complex (international) organizations and surroundings.
As a natural troubleshooter and experienced (project) manager able to consistently solve problems and deliver results by building bridges and networks within, and transcending, the organization.

Specialties: project/program management, sales & marketing, communications, developing and implementing new capabilities, innovation, implementation, connecting people and fields of expertise, stakeholder management, negotiation, entrepreneurship, teaching and mentoring, consulting.

Sectors: Government, Not-For-Profit, International Development, Tourism, Education

□ Advised the steering committee Sharp & Efficient
□ Managed internal/external suppliers and stakeholders in both business and IT organisations
□ Redesigned en helped implement current process of digitalising paper documents

□ Reported directly to the Management Team
□ Advised the Management Team and the Board of Directors
□ Led a project team (members from the Licensing, Legal Affairs and Communications department)
□ Cooperated closely with the project manager Bill Remote Gambling and the project manager Regulation & Enforcement Remote Gambling
□ Cooperated with the policy and law makers of the Department of Security and Justice in order to realise a remote gambling law and delegated legislation

The Dutch Gaming Authority is an independent regulator mainly responsible for a well regulated and trustworthy supply of games of chance and consumer protection.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jeroen', 'last_name': 'Uittenbogaard', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Account/Relationship Manager |

I was asked by the Ministry of the Interior to make this assessment, bring to light risks (if any) and to suggest (counter) measures. Since the inquiry focused on the period 1990-present it was quite a puzzle. Nevertheless, the assessment got done and the findings were shared with their Secretary-General who then decided on some follow-ups.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jeroen', 'last_name': 'Uittenbogaard', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Account/Relationship Manager | 
Consultant | Project/Program Manager
'}]}, {'title': 'Project 4 – Integrity and Screening Agency – Security and Justice', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'I was asked to prepare phase 3 of their ICT-programme ‘Sharp and Efficient’. The programme is meant to realise a whole new set of capabilities for the agency by updating current ICT-systems, developing new ones and integrating them. The main objective of this phase was to deliver a set of digital services for the different customer groups of the agency.

□ Reported to the programme manager and steering committee
(director of Production, director of Policy & Operations, head of ICT)
□ Responsible for defining phase 3 ‘Digital customer services’  of the programme, e.g.
▪Goals, scope, results
▪Business case
▪Project portfolio
▪Risk assessment
▪Legal requirements (privacy issues and information security)
□ Led a project team (members from the legal, ICT, production and strategy department) 
□ Prepared and gave workshops

of ICT and Strategic Procurement – Security and Justice', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': 'I was asked to help the strategic procurement team on the implementation of the planned federal electronic procurement system.

□ Reported directly to the head of Strategic Procurement
□ Responsible for preparing all the agencies within the Ministry of Security and Justice to implement the new federal government-wide Electronic Procurement system
□ Led a project team (members from the strategic procurement, control and risk department)
□ Wrote guidelines for the procurement specialists on how to introduce the new system to suppliers
□ Managed multiple technical and legal issues which arose from integrating the new government-wide system with the newly introduced procurement system from the Ministry of Security and Justice
□ Gave presentations to, and managed expectations of, all the agencies of the Ministry of Security and Justice
□ Member of both the interdepartmental Project Manager Committee (responsible for the implementation of the procurement system) and the interdepartmental Reference Committee (responsible for the specifications of the procurement system)

The department of ICT and Strategic Procurement is a mixture of two fields of expertise. The different ICT teams are responsible for a variety of things; giving advice on information security and ICT-architecture or leading ICT-related projects. The strategic procurement team is mainly responsible for making sure all the agencies within the Ministry of Security and Justice follow the federal regulations concerning procurement.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jeroen', 'last_name': 'Uittenbogaard', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Account/Relationship Manager |

Its aim was to deliver an online application for residents of The Netherlands to apply for a “Declaration of Good Conduct” to simplify the existing complex application process which required Dutch residents to report to their local authority in person.

□ Reported directly to the director of Policy & Operations
□ Responsible for developing and piloting an online application service (from online authentication to online paying) for the Declaration of Good Conduct
□ Led a project team (members from the legal, ICT and production department)
□ Acted as principal for the ICTU, the Dutch e-government organisation, which was the senior supplier of the technology involved
□ Wrote internal guidelines for the Customer Contact Centre on how to deal with questions from customers and how to manage technical difficulties
□ Facilitated the legal department in getting the necessary changes in law through the different layers of government
□ Prepared the agency and surrounding stakeholders for nation-wide implementation of the service
□ Introduced the agency to a new e-government building block which enables the digital authentication of organisations (e-recognition)
□ Acted as spokesperson for the agency on this topic when dealing with major external stakeholders (e.g. The Confederation of Netherlands Industry and Employers, commercial screening organisations and The Dutch Data Protection Authority)

The Integrity and Screening Agency (www.justis.nl) is the screening authority of the Ministry of Security and Justice and consequently responsible for the screening of persons and organisations. They analyse information from different sources in order to pass judgment on the integrity of persons and organisations while participating in society.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Jeroen', 'last_name': 'Uittenbogaard', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Account/Relationship Manager |

□ Reported directly to the overall project manager of the implementation team of the Services Directive in The Netherlands
□ Responsible for the nation-wide communication and implementation of all the directives in the Services Directive concerning Administrative Cooperation and the use of the IMI system by all competent authorities in The Netherlands
□ Led an inter-departmental project team (members from the legal and policy departments of the Ministry of the Interior, Ministry of Economic Affairs and the Ministry of Security and Justice)
□ Acted as principal for the ICTU, the Dutch e-government organisation, which was the senior supplier of the technology involved
□ Facilitated the legal department of the Ministry of Economic Affairs and the Ministry of Security and Justice in getting the necessary changes in law through the different layers of government
□ Acted as spokesperson for the government of The Netherlands on this topic when negotiating in Brussels with the European Commission and member countries
□ Presented to, and managed expectations of, all the Dutch competent authorities

(see below for more job-specific information)", 'title': 'Management Trainee', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}]
volunteer_experiences: [{'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'role': 'Business Mentor', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Yoga Yangchen', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHqPOH47Lu6NA/company-logo_400_400/0/1598710484188?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=d0YuRFoYNpwxhga-01nPdZzuJthlMbBaTPVP2VUe-BY', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/yogayangchen/'}, 'cause': 'ECONOMIC_EMPOWERMENT', 'description': "Supporting a young Bhutanese entrepreneur in realizing her dream to become a yoga teacher and establishing her own yoga studio in Bhutan. I have helped her create her brand, setup all of her online channels (website, Facebook, Instagram, Google Business) and guided her in how to further build her brand. Together we created her business model, corporate identity (logo, letterhead, etc) and defined the business' main processes and procedures. She officially opened her studio on the 19th of September 2020, after which my guidance is mainly focused on sales & marketing and basic operational challenges a young entrepreneur in Bhutan runs into. On the 3rd of December 2020 she won the 2nd place in the Bhutan New Venture Challenge 2020."}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'role': 'Consultant', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Bhutan Animal Rescue and Care (BARC)', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'ANIMAL_RIGHTS', 'description': 'As a pro bono consultant I was engaged in my free time in professionalizing the BARC organization on different levels, from strategic to operational.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'role': 'Mentor', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Giving Back ', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E0BAQGdAItZj9Jptg/company-logo_400_400/0/1665735845128?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=yKfWVBeWr-zgMFZs-Ptp5gs7Xp62sijiQQeA0kcK3LA', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/givingbackinternational/'}, 'cause': 'EDUCATION', 'description': 'Giving Back (www.givingback.nl) helps proven talented young people to reach a successful place in society. The foundation guides talented high school students between the ages of 15 and 18 by giving workshops on a variety of themes (e.g. Law, Politics, Debating, Networking) and matching them to a mentor for the duration of two years.\nI mentored a very talented young man called Riyaz. After he graduated high school he went to college and successfully graduated in the field of Skin Therapy. Furthermore, he is a creator of Japanese influenced art works. Riyaz told me he learned a lot from me, but in truth I think I learned even more from him.'}]
